alert.note: Alert for Dent (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 2:20PM CST until March 07 at 10:37AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of south central Missouri, including the following county, Dent. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 219 PM CST, The Department of Transportation reported that several roads across the county remain flooded from previous heavy rain in the warned area. - This includes the following low water crossings... Sinking Creek at County Road 568, Crooked Creek at Highway TT, Dry Fork Creek at County Road 2430, Gladden Creek at County Road 624 and Meramec River at Spur Road. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salem, Bunker, Howes, Gladden, Darien, Turtle, Jadwin, Bangert, Stone Hill, Sligo, Howes Mill, Anutt, Lake Spring, Montauk, Lenox, Lecoma, Boss, Montauk State Park and Ozark National Scenic Riverways. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
